intro: Micromeria microphylla var. imbricata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, linear leaves and clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its flowers are primarily pollinated by insects, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
